name: abjectly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in an extreme or bad way: The administration had failed abjectly in its duty to protect the country. They performed abjectly, losing all four of their matches.
in a way that shows no pride or respect for yourself: "I let you down all the time", he said abjectly. He abjectly pleaded illness to avoid doing the test.
More examplesFewer examplesWhat went so abjectly wrong?They are not abjectly poor like some of the people in the village.It was an abjectly miserable experience.He said he was abjectly ashamed of his behaviour.
